p: We next sought to identify the molecular mechanisms underlying the fall in DC progenitors in the BM during influenza infection. It was recently reported that IFN-γ signalling impairs cDC development after systemic infection with Y. Enterocolitica [ 30]. To study the potential role of IFN-γ in our setting, Ifng -/- mice were infected with IAV. As was the case in wild type (WT) mice, Ifng -/- mice exhibited a significant decrease in CDP and pre-DC numbers at 7 dpi ( Fig 6A). Of note, IFN-γ deficiency did not restore the drop of Flt3-L concentration in the sera ( Fig 6B). Moreover, the treatment of IAV-infected mice with anti-IFN-γ monoclonal Ab did not restore the number of CDPs or pre-DCs, when compared with isotype-treated mice ( Fig 6C). This suggests that the changes in cDC generation during IAV infection are IFN-γ independent.
